author: Special Correspondent
text:
As part of its efforts to provide better services to customers, the Postal Department will bring more post offices in the city under intensive surveillance soon. Ten more post offices, including those at Ambattur, K.K.Nagar, Anna Nagar, Avadi and Tambaram, will have closed circuit television cameras installed in a few months.

At present, eight post offices including the Anna Road head post office and those in areas such as T. Nagar, Mylapore, Arumbakkam, Flower Bazaar and Tondiarpet have CCTV cameras installed at a cost of nearly Rs. 5 lakh.

Following advice from the police to step up surveillance, the postal department plans to install such cameras in post offices that are expected to register considerable footfall.

Hubs and warehouses

Some other important units like the speed post hub at St.Thomas Mount, railway mail service units and Ekkaduthangal e-commerce warehouses already have been covered.

Mervin Alexander, Postmaster general (Chennai city region) said: “There have been instances where cameras have helped us detect pilferage and also trace people who wrote anonymous letters through speed posts and check the genuineness of issues.”
title: 10 more post offices to have CCTV cameras
